Parameter.Label: Stay Awake in Battery Mode
Parameter.Help: Stay awake for 10 minutes when re-powering the MultiSensor (battery mode)

Parameter.Label: Motion Sensor Timeout
Parameter.Help:
How long should the device associated to MultiSensor keep state On before sending Off command.
If the value is bigger than 255, the value would be rounded to next integer in minutes, else to seconds.

Parameter.Label: Motion sensor sensitivity
Parameter.Help: Sensitivity level of PIR sensor (1=minimum, 5=maximum)

Parameter.Label: Low Battery Report
Parameter.Help: Report Low Battery if below this value. The range of low battery value is 10% to 50%.

Parameter.Label: Selective Reporting
Parameter.Help: Send reports only when measurements reach a certain threshold or percentage set in parameters 41-44.

Parameter.Label: Temperature Threshold
Parameter.Help:
Threshold change in temperature to induce an automatic report.
The unit is Fahrenheit for US version, Celsius for EU/AU version.
The value contains one decimal point. E.g. if the value is set to 20, the
threshold value is 2.0 ? (EU/AU version) or 2.0 ? (US version).
If the current temperature gap is larger than 2.0, a temperature report will be sent out.

Parameter.Label: Humidity Threshold
Parameter.Help:
Threshold change in humidity to induce an automatic report.
The unit is %.
If the current humidity gap is larger than this value, sensor will send out a humidity report.

Parameter.Label: Luminance Threshold
Parameter.Help:
Threshold change in luminance to induce an automatic report.
The unit is lux.
If the current luminance gap is larger than this value, sensor will send out a luminance report.

Parameter.Label: Battery Threshold
Parameter.Help:
Threshold change in battery level to induce an automatic report.
The unit is %.
If the current battery gap is larger than this value, sensor will send out a battery report.

Parameter.Label: Ultraviolet Threshold
Parameter.Help:
Threshold change in ultraviolet light to induce an automatic report.
The unit is UV index scale.

Parameter.Label: Send Alarm Report if low temperature
Parameter.Help: Send an alarm report if temperature is less than -15 Â°C

Parameter.Label: Set parameters 101-103 to default.
Parameter.Help: not sure how exactly this is supposed to work ...

Parameter.Label: Group 1 Periodic Reports
Parameter.Help:
This value is a combination number made up of the sum of the values
for the individual sensors and battery. The sensors have these values:
Battery=1, Ultraviolet=16, Temperature=32, Humidity=64, Light=128
So if you want all sensors and the battery sending regular reports, set the parameter to 241 (1 + 16 + 32 + 64 + 128).

Parameter.Label: Group 2 Periodic Reports
Parameter.Help:
This value is a combination number made up of the sum of the values
for the individual sensors and battery. The sensors have these values:
Battery=1, Ultraviolet=16, Temperature=32, Humidity=64, Light=128.
So if you want all sensors and the battery sending regular reports, set the parameter to 241 (1 + 16 + 32 + 64 + 128).

Parameter.Label: Group 3 Periodic Reports
Parameter.Help:
The value is a combination number made up of the sum of the values
for the individual sensors and battery. The sensors have these values:
Battery=1, Ultraviolet=16, Temperature=32, Humidity=64, Light=128.
So if you want all sensors and the battery sending regular reports,
set the parameter to 241 (1 + 16 + 32 + 64 + 128).

Parameter.Label: Set parameters 111-113 to default.
Parameter.Help: not sure how exactly this is supposed to work ...

Parameter.Label: Group 1 Report Interval
Parameter.Help:
The unit of interval time is second if USB powered.
If battery powered, the minimum interval time is 60 minutes by default.
For example, if the value is set to be more than 5 and less than 3600, the interval
time is 60 minutes, and if the value is set to be more than 3600 and less than 7200,
the interval time is 120 minutes. You can also change the minimum interval time to
4 minutes via setting the interval value(3 bytes) to 240 in Wake Up Interval Set CC.

Parameter.Label: Group 2 Report Interval
Parameter.Help:
The unit of interval time is second if USB powered.
If battery powered, the minimum interval time is 60 minutes by default.
For example, if the value is set to be more than 5 and less than 3600, the interval
time is 60 minutes, if the value is set to be more than 3600 and less than 7200,
the interval time is 120 minutes. You can also change the minimum interval time to
4 minutes via setting the interval value(3 bytes) to 240 in Wake Up Interval Set CC.

Parameter.Label: Group 3 Report Interval
Parameter.Help:
The unit of interval time is second if USB powered.
If battery powered, the minimum interval time is 60 minutes by default.
For example, if the value is set to be more than 5 and less than 3600, the interval
time is 60 minutes, if the value is set to be more than 3600 and less than 7200,
the interval time is 120 minutes. You can also change the minimum interval time
to 4 minutes via setting the interval value(3 bytes) to 240 in Wake Up Interval Set CC.

Parameter.Label: Temperature Calibration
Parameter.Help:
The range of calibration value is -100 to 100 (or -10.0 to +10.0 degrees).
The value contains one decimal point. E.g. if the value is set to 20, the
calibration value is 2.0 ? (EU/AU version) or 2.0 ? (US version).
The calibration value = standard value - measure value.
Example: if measured value = 25.3? and the standard value = 23.2?, then
calibration value= 23.2? - 25.3? = -2.1? (0xEB).

Parameter.Label: Humidity Sensor Calibration
Parameter.Help:
The range of calibration value is -50 to 50 (percent).
The calibration value = standard value - measure value.
Example: if measured value = 80RH and the standard value = 75RH, then calibration
value = 75 â 80 = -5 (0xFB).

Parameter.Label: Luminance Sensor Calibration
Parameter.Help:
The range of calibration value is -1000 to 1000 (lux).
The calibration value = standard value - measure value.
Example: if measured value = 800 Lux and the standard value = 750 Lux, then
calibration value= 750 â 800 = -50 (0xFFCE).

Parameter.Label: Ultraviolet Sensor Calibration
Parameter.Help:
The range of calibration value is -10 to 10 (UV index scale).
The calibration value = standard value - measure value.
Example: if measured value = 9 and the standard value = 8, then
calibration value = 8 â 9 = -1 (0xFE).

Item.Label: Resets all configuration parameters to default settings
Reset to default factory settings and be excluded from the Z-wave network

Group.Label: Group 1
Group.Help:
Group 1 is assigned to the Lifeline association group,
and every device has 5 nodes to associate. The motion sensor, humidity sensor, thermometer,
light sensor and ultraviolet sensor reports will be sent to the associated nodes in Group 1.
